lines.text: You certainly led me a merry chase!
Oh, thank you officer, and a merry chase to you too!
Ah, officer...
Goin' 60 miles an hour.
Oh, were you? So were we!
Uh, uh, listen, officer...
What's your name?
Um, uh, Gracie Downey. What's yours?
Patrick Mc... wait a minute!
Oh, Patrick McWaitaminute. Isn't that a pretty name? How is Mrs. McWaitaminute? and all the little McWaitaseconds?
Say, are you trying to kid me?
Ah, hah. Oh, George, the officer wants you to kid him. You're a good kidder. Say something to him.
Quiet!
Whatta mean 'quiet?' OGne more quiet out of you, and I'll punch you right in the nose.
That's a good comeback. Now, Georgoe-Porgie, it's your turn. Say something to the officer.
I think I'll give you a ticket.
Oh, that's awfully nice of you. Will you make it out for two so I can take Georgie with me,
Gracie, it's not the kind of ticket that you think it is. It's a ticket to traffic court.
Oh, what's playing there?
A judge and a jury.
Oh, I've seen that picture!
Listen officer, can't we talk this over? You know, I've got an uncle who's a motorcycle cop.
Yeah, and he's handsome too, just like you.
Oh. Flattery, eh?
No, O'Flanagan.
Turnabout is foul play!
Yeah, and if they don't hang me on Monday, its because they hung me on Sunday!
Gracie, you talk like an imbecile!
Aw, Georgie, you flatterer you!
Buy a pencil?
I got nothin' to write home about.
